title: EnglishPod 初级 英文播客 0036

segments.en: Hello, English learners.
Welcome back to EnglishPod.
My name is Marco.
And I'm Erika.
And today we're bringing you the third part of this series that we've created called, I'm Sorry, I Love You.
segments.cn: 今天我们为您带来这个系列的第三部分，名为“对不起，我爱你”。

segments.en: That's right.
The third part in our story about our EnglishPod couple.
segments.cn: 这是关于我们EnglishPod情侣故事的第三部分。

segments.en: Yeah, it's a romantic series, but today we're bringing you in argument.
segments.cn: 是的，这是一个浪漫系列，但今天我们带来的是争吵。

segments.en: That's right.
Like in every relationship, you have fights, you have discussions.
segments.cn: 在每段关系中，你会有争吵和讨论。

segments.en: So we're going to teach you how to do that in English.
segments.cn: 所以我们将教你如何用英语进行这些。

segments.en: That's right.
In today's lesson, you'll learn some great language that people use when they get into an argument with their boyfriend or girlfriend.
segments.cn: 在今天的课程中，你将学习一些人们在与男朋友或女朋友争吵时使用的好词汇。

segments.en: Right, so why don't we take a look at vocabulary preview.
segments.cn: 好的，那我们来看看词汇预览。

segments.en: Vocabulary preview.
We have one phrase today.
Get a hold.
Get a hold.
Get a hold.
To get a hold.
To get a hold of someone means... To try and communicate with that person.
segments.cn: 联系某人意味着... 尝试与那个人沟通。

segments.en: Exactly.
So to try and call that person.
segments.cn: 所以尝试给那个人打电话。

segments.en: For example, I can say, I've been calling his phone all day, but I can't get a hold of him.
segments.cn: 例如，我可以说，我整天都在打他的电话，但我联系不上他。

segments.en: Or I could say, finally Marco, I got a hold of you.
segments.cn: 或者我可以说，终于Marco，我联系上你了。

segments.en: Where have you been all day?
Exactly.
Now we're going to listen to our dialogue, and as always, it's going to be at a normal pace, but you don't have to worry about it.
segments.cn: 现在我们要听我们的对话，和往常一样，速度会正常，但你不必担心。

segments.en: We'll come back and teach you all of the important words.
segments.cn: 我们会回来教你所有重要的单词。

segments.en: Steven, where have you been?
I've been trying to get a hold of you for hours.
segments.cn: 我已经试图联系你几个小时了。

segments.en: I, uh, there was an emergency at work, so... I was waiting for you in the restaurant for three hours, and you didn't even have the decency to call me.
segments.cn: 我，呃，工作上有紧急情况，所以... 我在餐厅等了你三个小时，你甚至没有给我打电话。

segments.en: Do you have any idea how embarrassed I was?
Honey, I promise this won't happen again.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我保证这不会再发生了。

segments.en: It's just that I... Yeah, right.
I've heard it all before.
I'm not going to take any more of your empty promises.
segments.cn: 我不会再接受你的空头承诺了。

segments.en: This is the fifth time you stood me up in two weeks.
segments.cn: 这是你两周内第五次放我鸽子。

segments.en: You need to get your priorities straight.
segments.cn: 你需要理清你的优先事项。

segments.en: I'm tired of you putting your job first all the time.
segments.cn: 我厌倦了你总是把工作放在第一位。

segments.en: Come on, Veronica.
That's not fair.
I do care about you a lot.
You know that.
I try to... You know what?
Maybe we should just take a break.
segments.cn: 也许我们应该休息一下。

segments.en: I need some time to think about where this relationship is heading.
segments.cn: 我需要一些时间来思考这段关系的方向。

segments.en: But, Veronica, would you listen to me?
There was a fire alarm at my office building today, and I was...
segments.cn: 今天我办公室大楼发生了火警，我...

segments.en: Okay, so a little bit of trouble in the relationship.
segments.cn: 好吧，关系中有一点麻烦。

segments.en: Yeah, that's too bad.
Yeah, well, I think she's overreacting.
segments.cn: 是的，我觉得她反应过度了。

segments.en: You do?
We'll talk about that later on.
But we saw some great words and phrases here, so it's time for Language Takeaway.
segments.cn: 但我们在这里看到了一些很好的单词和短语，所以是时候进行语言总结了。

segments.en: Today on Language Takeaway, we're bringing you three words.
segments.cn: 今天的语言总结，我们带来了三个单词。

segments.en: The first word is stood me up.
The phrase stand someone up.
When do we use this?
segments.cn: 我们什么时候使用这个？

segments.en: If, for example, you have a date and you don't go.
segments.cn: 如果，例如，你有一个约会，但你没有去。

segments.en: Okay, so let's say you and I were supposed to have dinner together, and you just didn't come.
segments.cn: 好吧，假设你和我本来应该一起吃晚餐，但你没有来。

segments.en: Right.
And didn't call.
Right, so I stood you up.
Yep, okay.
Stand someone up.
Our next word, priorities.
segments.cn: 我们下一个词，优先事项。

segments.en: Priorities?
Priorities.
So priorities are something that's really important in your life.
segments.cn: 所以优先事项是你生活中非常重要的事情。

segments.en: That's right, like family or maybe work or making a lot of money or whatever it is.
segments.cn: 没错，比如家庭、工作或赚很多钱，或者其他任何事情。

segments.en: What are your priorities in life?
segments.cn: 你生活中的优先事项是什么？

segments.en: Right, yeah.
Okay.
And our last word for Language Takeaway, heading.
segments.cn: 我们的最后一个语言总结词，方向。

segments.en: Heading.
Heading.
Heading.
This is a bit of a funny verb, so let's listen to a couple of examples of how it's used so we can understand its meaning.
segments.cn: 这是一个有点有趣的动词，所以让我们听几个例子，看看它是如何使用的，以便我们理解它的意思。

segments.en: Example one.
I don't know where our relationship is heading.
segments.cn: 我不知道我们的关系将走向何方。

segments.en: Example two.
Where is this bus heading?
Example three.
Where is this project heading?
So basically heading means going.
segments.cn: 所以基本上，方向意味着去。

segments.en: Exactly.
A heading is where you're going.
segments.cn: 方向就是你要去的地方。

segments.en: Yep.
Okay, easy word.
Interesting.
Okay, so now it's time for us to listen to the dialogue a second time.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在是时候我们第二次听对话了。

segments.en: It's going to be slower so now we can understand the words that we just talked about.
segments.cn: 速度会慢一些，这样我们就能理解我们刚刚讨论的单词。

segments.en: Steven, where have you been?
I've been trying to get a hold of you for hours.
segments.cn: 我已经试图联系你几个小时了。

segments.en: I... there was an emergency at work, so... I was waiting for you in the restaurant for three hours.
segments.cn: 我... 工作上有紧急情况，所以... 我在餐厅等了你三个小时。

segments.en: And you didn't even have the decency to call me.
segments.cn: 你甚至没有给我打电话。

segments.en: Do you have any idea how embarrassed I was?
Honey, I promise this won't happen again.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我保证这不会再发生了。

segments.en: It's just that I... Yeah, right.
I've heard it all before.
I'm not going to take any more of your empty promises.
segments.cn: 我不会再接受你的空头承诺了。

segments.en: This is the fifth time you've stood me up in two weeks.
segments.cn: 这是你两周内第五次放我鸽子。

segments.en: You need to get your priorities straight.
segments.cn: 你需要理清你的优先事项。

segments.en: I'm tired of you putting your job first all the time.
segments.cn: 我厌倦了你总是把工作放在第一位。

segments.en: Come on, Veronica.
That's not fair.
I do care about you.
A lot.
You know that.
I tried to... You know what?
Maybe we should just take a break.
segments.cn: 也许我们应该休息一下。

segments.en: I need some time to think about where this relationship is heading.
segments.cn: 我需要一些时间来思考这段关系的方向。

segments.en: But, Veronica, would you just listen to me?
segments.cn: 但是，维罗妮卡，你能听我说吗？

segments.en: There was a fire alarm at my office building today, and I was stuck...
segments.cn: 今天我办公室大楼有火警，我被困住了...

segments.en: Okay, now, we saw some interesting phrases in dialogue.
segments.cn: 好吧，现在，我们在对话中看到了一些有趣的短语。

segments.en: Yeah, we saw some great phrases that people use when they're getting in a fight.
segments.cn: 是的，我们看到了一些人们在争吵时使用的好短语。

segments.en: Right.
Why don't we take a look at some of them in Fluency Builder.
segments.cn: 为什么我们不看看在流利表达中使用的一些短语呢？

segments.en: Fluency Builder.
The first phrase that I want to take a look at today is, do you have any idea?
segments.cn: 我今天想看的第一个短语是，你知道吗？

segments.en: Do you have any idea?
Do you have any idea?
This is a great way to set up an argument.
segments.cn: 这是一个很好的方式来引发争论。

segments.en: So, let's listen to some examples of how you would set up an argument using this phrase.
segments.cn: 所以，让我们听听如何使用这个短语引发争论的例子。

segments.en: Example one.
You forgot my birthday.
Do you have any idea how angry I am?
Example two.
Julie kissed my boyfriend.
Does she have any idea how mean that was?
Example three.
I just broke up with my boyfriend.
Don't you have any idea how sad I am?
segments.cn: 你不知道我有多伤心吗？

segments.en: So it's a great phrase to make that person understand that you were really worried or... Really angry.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个很好的短语，让对方明白你真的很担心或... 非常生气。

segments.en: And now the second phrase that we can take a look at is, I've heard it all before.
segments.cn: 现在我们可以看看第二个短语，我听过这些。

segments.en: I've heard it all before.
I've heard it all before.
So this is a great phrase of just saying, you don't have to give me an excuse, I know what you're going to say.
segments.cn: 所以这是一个很好的短语，表示你不需要给我借口，我知道你要说什么。

segments.en: And our last phrase today, take a break.
segments.cn: 我们今天的最后一个短语，休息一下。

segments.en: Take a break.
So when a couple takes a break, they sort of stop their relationship, right?
segments.cn: 所以当一对情侣休息时，他们有点停止了关系，对吧？

segments.en: They're breaking up.
Yeah, but is it really like forever?
segments.cn: 是的，但这真的是永远吗？

segments.en: Like a breakup that lasts forever?
Well, maybe.
It could be forever, but they're saying let's just take some time away from each other for a couple of days or weeks.
segments.cn: 可能是永远，但他们说让我们暂时分开几天或几周。

segments.en: Yeah, yeah.
And see what happens.
Yes.
Take a break.
Take a break.
Okay, so our happy couple is going to take a break.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以我们的快乐情侣要休息一下。

segments.en: Well, I guess they're not that happy then, hey?
segments.cn: 嗯，我想他们并不那么快乐，是吧？

segments.en: Yeah.
Okay, so let's listen to our dialogue again, and then we'll come back and talk some more.
segments.cn: 好吧，所以让我们再听一遍对话，然后我们再回来聊聊。

segments.en: Steven, where have you been?
I've been trying to get a hold of you for hours.
segments.cn: 我试图联系你几个小时。

segments.en: I, uh, there was an emergency at work, so... I was waiting for you in the restaurant for three hours, and you didn't even have the decency to call me.
segments.cn: 我，呃，工作上有紧急情况，所以... 我在餐厅等了你三个小时，你连打个电话的体面都没有。

segments.en: Do you have any idea how embarrassed I was?
Honey, I promise this won't happen again.
segments.cn: 亲爱的，我保证这不会再发生了。

segments.en: It's just that I... Yeah, right.
I've heard it all before.
I'm not going to take any more of your empty promises.
segments.cn: 我不会再接受你的空头承诺了。

segments.en: This is the fifth time you stood me up in two weeks.
segments.cn: 这是你两周内第五次放我鸽子。

segments.en: You need to get your priorities straight.
segments.cn: 你需要理清你的优先事项。

segments.en: I'm tired of you putting your job first all the time.
segments.cn: 我厌倦了你总是把工作放在第一位。

segments.en: Come on, Veronica.
That's not fair.
I do care about you a lot, you know that.
segments.cn: 我是很在乎你的，你知道的。

segments.en: I try to... You know what?
Maybe we should just take a break.
segments.cn: 也许我们应该休息一下。

segments.en: I need some time to think about where this relationship is heading.
segments.cn: 我需要一些时间来思考这段关系的方向。

segments.en: But, Veronica, would you listen to me?
segments.cn: 但是，维罗妮卡，你能听我说吗？

segments.en: There was a fire alarm at my office building today, and I was...
segments.cn: 今天我办公室大楼有火警，我被...

segments.en: So, Marco, this phrase, to take a break, really reminds me of a Friends episode.
segments.cn: 所以，马尔科，这个短语，休息一下，真的让我想起了一集《老友记》。

segments.en: Yeah, that really famous Friends episode when Ross and Rachel were on a break.
segments.cn: 是的，那集非常著名的《老友记》，罗斯和瑞秋在休息。

segments.en: And Ross, like, went with another girl, right?
segments.cn: 罗斯和另一个女孩在一起，对吧？

segments.en: Yeah, and then they definitely broke up after that.
segments.cn: 是的，然后他们确实在那之后分手了。

segments.en: So that's one of the key issues, right?
segments.cn: 所以这是一个关键问题，对吧？

segments.en: If you're taking a break, can you start to date someone else?
segments.cn: 如果你在休息，你可以开始和其他人约会吗？

segments.en: I've got to agree with Rachel.
Really?
Yeah, no, you can't.
You can't.
So what's the point of taking a break?
segments.cn: 那么休息的意义是什么？

segments.en: Just, you need some time away.
segments.cn: 只是，你需要一些时间远离。

segments.en: You need some time to think.
But you're not really broken up.
Exactly.
That's convenient.
I don't know.
They were on a break.
I agree with Ross.
Well, you would, wouldn't you?
Alright, guys, we're out of time today.
segments.cn: 好吧，大家，今天时间到了。

segments.en: Hope you enjoyed our lesson.
segments.cn: 希望你们喜欢我们的课程。

segments.en: And be sure to listen next time because we will definitely have a part 4 to this.
segments.cn: 下次一定要收听，因为我们肯定会有第四部分。

segments.en: Yes.
Coming out soon.
Yep.
And also come to our website at EnglishPod.com and leave all your questions and comments.
segments.cn: 还请访问我们的网站 EnglishPod.com，留下你们的所有问题和评论。

segments.en: Yeah, Marco and I are always happy to hear from you and we love answering your questions.
segments.cn: 是的，马尔科和我总是很高兴听到你们的声音，我们喜欢回答你们的问题。

segments.en: Right, and maybe you can tell us what you think happens in the fourth part.
segments.cn: 对了，也许你可以告诉我们你认为第四部分会发生什么。

segments.en: Yeah.
Okay.
Well, until then, it's goodbye.
